result.execSummary:
The defendant Reginald A Ward was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Carry Concealed Weapon, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.23(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Fine to be paid at a rate of $100.00 per month commencing 11/1/22 and each month thereafter.  Penalty of civil judgment for non-payment.

Costs to be paid along with fine payments.

Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
Court orders the forfeiture of the seized firearm.  The holding law enforcement agency can destroy the firearm pursuant to statute.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Reginald A Ward

records.addlTxt:
Plaintiff State of Wisconsin in court, by ADA Andrew Neshiem.
Defendant Reginald A Ward appeared by video.  
Attorney William Robert Kerner appeared by video for Reginald A Ward. 
All parties have agreed that some may have the hearing conducted remotely. This hearing has met the statutory standards for video conferencing. 
Victim rights have been complied with by the Waukesha County District Attorneys Office. 

Defendant enters a plea of Guilty to the charge.
Court finds the defendant Guilty of the charge.

Court orders the following:	
Fine:  $379
DNA Sample and Surcharge:  $ 200
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
To be paid at the rate of $100 per month, starting 11/01/2022 and the 1st of every month until paid in full.
Alternate:  Entry of civil judgment

Court will also order forfeiture of the seized firearm - The holding law enforcement agency can destroy the firearm pursuant to statute.
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 22, 2022 at 09:00 am.

08:35 AM Attorney William Robert Kerner in court.   Defendant Reginald A Ward did not appear.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern Jack Rieder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Authorization to appear received and filed on 08/04/2022.   Victim rights have been complied with by the Waukesha County District Attorneys Office.

Atty Kerner has an offer that his client will be accepting and requests a plea/sentencing hearing date. Atty Kerner requests that his client be allowed to appear by zoom. 

State confirms disposition would be fine only and that they do not object to the Defendant appearing by zoom.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 22, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Authorization to appear received and filed.
Effective August 1, 2022, this case is assigned to Branch 4, the Honorable Lloyd V. Carter, pursuant to 22-SO-04(67).

Defendant is not to possess any dangerous weapons/firearms/knives, with the exception if the defendant is attempting to attend a certified CCW course, he may possess a weapon for the purposes of that course.

08:49 AM Defendant Reginald A Ward in court with attorney William Robert Kerner.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Hearing scheduled for August 8, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Adjustment Number: 22A 025469,
Payable Number: 468551,
Receipt Number: 22R 027417,
Amount: $20.00
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection and Notice of Intent to Use Defendant's Statement and DNA Evidence.
